mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Lawson, Robert, 1748-1805
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Thanks him for letter of 22nd June last and $50 placed in hands of Major Duval for self; has been ill; son prevented from coming for him by considerable business as stone mason in Nashville; experienced driver will take him, with two good horses and light stage wagon, for 60 pounds; friends think it not unreasonable but self has not the money; [incomplete].
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1802 May 31, [Richm]ond, [Virginia] to [Thomas Jefferson], n.p.
